website_summaries.verdict: Generous maximum weight capacity in a customizable design. A good choice if you're looking for a solid mid-range power rack.
pros: Sturdy steel frame is built with triangular reinforcements for added stability
Interior safety bars hold up to 800 pounds
Features 26 safety bar height adjustments and a multi-grip pull-up bar for workout variation
Comes with four plate pegs for storage
cons: Weight plates stored on the upper plate pegs can get in the way of bench pressing

customer_reviews.title: These are great products. I hesitated for a long while as ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the power cage with cablecrossover and lat pull down for my home gym. These are great products. I hesitated for a long while as I was uncertain about whether the crossover was going to be the quality and style I was looking for. My fears were quickly dissipated once I used the product. I have been using them for a while now and can quickly recommend the entire setup.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: The frame is thin compared to some accessories I purchased from Titan that are compatible with this unit. I had to get a new pulley mount because the first one broke, then the second one was incorrect, then the third was it, but I had to use another washer to clear the swivel or it will snap if they dont freely pivot back and forth. Thankfully they were free both the incorrect one and the correct one. ALSO; be prepared to purchase olympic adaptors because the unit comes with standard pegs on the frame, and all the slides which was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this thing is perfect. i did a lot of research first and ...
customer_reviews.text: this thing is perfect. i did a lot of research first and decided i wanted this one. I am very happy with my choice. it is very easy to put together too. here is a picture of it. (Note that the bench, bar and weights are not included they are separate)
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Been using it for two months now - still pleased. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for two months now - still pleased. Very sturdy, no wobble, still feels solid. Allows me to accomplish my workout goals at home. The lat pull down attachment is well worth it also. Small cost to add a competent functioning cable system.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased the equipment about a month ago. The quality was not great but we were willing to make some concessions since we were paying a bit less than other racks. My biggest frustration is that the hardware was not all included and when we tried to contact the seller, they did not respond. (Via email and phone.) I had to go to the hardware store and purchase another $30+ of missing bolts to be able to finish assembling. Also - some of the hardware was in poor condition. It also has some design flaws and the parts are pretty cheap. Disappointed. Eventually we will save up for a better system.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best for home gym
customer_reviews.text: Best squat rack I've ever used. Plenty of space to store weights on the sides and I love the pull up bar with different grips. Genius design. It fits perfectly in a room with 8 foot ceilings, the pull up bar is around 7 feet high so I never hit my head on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this power rack, so I can maximize my workouts. Box came in two parts, not a big deal. Pieces all there and enough washers and screws to assemble the rack with no issues. Assembled the rack with no problem, Welds seem clean and strong, and enough washers and screws to complete the assembly. Did a couple of workouts and it held up pretty well, pull-ups, bench press, shrugs, squats. Would definitely recommend this rack!
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Lazare

customer_reviews.title: Nice power rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice rack for the money, also like being able to buy the lat/row cable attachment for it. Awesome thinking, saves space for a home gym. Pic has attached lat/row
customer_reviews.author: Carl M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice home unit, not quite commercial grade
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, packaging was questionable at best. But everything in fine shape. Whole set takes hours to set up but nothing too bad. A helper at times would really make it work quicker. The lat part works nicely and very smooth for a home machine. Fly machine is less smooth but overall gets the job done, but this is not a commercial grade smoothness. But for 1k it’s well worth it not to have to travel. Not exact measurement but you will need approx 10x10 spot to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Great for Accessory workouts.
customer_reviews.text: Love my BD-33 rack and already have the dip attachments. One thing I was missing after quitting the gym was the ability to do tricep extensions and lat pulldown assistance exercises. This lat tower works well and was easy to install. I haven't loaded more to 200 lbs on it but so far it has held up well. Also came with a full lat bar and a smaller bar and a chain.
customer_reviews.author: paboothz71

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Easy to put together Sturdy Con's
customer_reviews.text: Five stars becuase it's very affordable and works well. Pro's: Cheap Easy to put together Sturdy Con's: 1" weight dolly pegs...should use 2" so Olympic plates would fit flush. It comes with clips so you can make your 2" plates work I have CAP all iron weight plates...the 25's will touch the foot pegs if you are doing a row workout...annoying...this does not effect lat pull work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would likely not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have a drill available to correct misalignment of holes and a rubber mallet to slam pieces together. Instructions should tell you not to tighten bolts if you have purchased accessories.. I am mostly bothered i spent this much and had to fix bad product build
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend you glue the plastic inserts onto the metal pole ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, well worth the price paid for functionality it added to the BD33 cage. I would recommend you glue the plastic inserts onto the metal pole the weight slides along as they will come loose quickly after building it. I glued them down and they have been fine since.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Very straight forward instructions. Also great customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, and supper durable. My Bf and I love how many functions we can do with this machine. The best fitness investment I’ve made.
customer_reviews.author: Yasmin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice attachment fo my home gym! It glides nice and smooth! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny M.

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and came in a few days early. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and came in a few days early. There were some scuffs on the metal but these were not from shipping, they looked to be from manufacturing. Overall, it did not take away from the quality of the unit. The boxes were beat up some and they tell you not to pick them up by the straps but that's exactly what UPS was doing.
customer_reviews.author: DPIT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power rack!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power rack. A little wobble but nothing to be concerned about. Would recommend a good set of j-hooks to go with the rack. Took about 30 minutes with the aid of a cordless drill to assemble. Didn't want a forearm workout doing that by hand with a set of wrenches. Assembly was intuitive and well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Giles B Beecroft

customer_reviews.title: This is a good set up for bench, squats etc
customer_reviews.text: I like everything on it. Putting this together was a little bit of a challenge if you dont' like to read me.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: excellent, love it and great price for the quality. had a minor issue when it arrived but customer service immediately took care of it
customer_reviews.author: amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This equipment is made of a sufficient gauge of metal. Aside from the placement of the weight storage bars, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, spacious, satisfying
customer_reviews.text: BD-33 only took 8 days to ship. Had it put together in an hour, this thing is nice. I haven’t tightened anything cuz I’m moving soon but it already feels sturdy. Glad I went with this rack. I’d recommend this but mainly recommend not going cheap, this equipment will last a long time if taken care of, an extra few bucks is worth it
customer_reviews.author: Beef Wellington

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rich Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The exact order of putting everything together isn't perfect. But still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!! A MUST BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: This attachment is a must!!! I have the Valor fitness BD-33 and this is the missing link to it!! It's such a huge difference in my workout routine. Worth the money for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Great system
customer_reviews.text: Amazing setup. Does almost everything you could want. Just needs a left developer on a bench.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not the most heavy duty but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Nice rack, only complaint is the thinness of the holding bar and that this doesn’t seem to work with an adapter sleeve really well.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time. Was easy to put together. Slight damage/scuff marks caused by shipping. Other than that equipment is as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Blanche C

customer_reviews.title: The lap bar is nice to have and helps focus in on form when ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed. Can do tons of different exercises with this lat pull. The lap bar is nice to have and helps focus in on form when doing seated stuff. It took a little tweaking to get the cables straight and tension correctly, but no big deal. The pulleys are not the highest quality, but is a good value for the $.
customer_reviews.author: B. Maness

customer_reviews.title: Valor fitness makes a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Even though my order got mixed up it was taken care of with just a couple of emails and no hassle. Valor fitness makes a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this! Put it together in about 30 minutes and it's very solid! I'm 6'1" and the pull up height is perfect for my reach! I got the lay pull down and dip bars as well. Perfect set-up for a home gym!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly for my Fitness Reality 810XLT SuperMax Power Cage
customer_reviews.author: Renzo Poblete

customer_reviews.title: They are spread an appropriate distance apart and are easy to move from position to position
customer_reviews.text: These fit my BD-7 Power rack perfectly. They are spread an appropriate distance apart and are easy to move from position to position. I'm almost 200lbs and they hold me without bending or flexing. They just work, nuff said. Check out the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Fits the 'Fitness Reality 810XLT' power cage PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: This fits EXACTLY with the vertical supports on the Fitness Reality 810XLT Super Max Power Cage. I also use this to rack my EZ curl bar when needed. The 365 lb safety limit is fortunately more than enough for my usage, even with weight dips. This is a major space saver if you don't already have a dedicated dip station. It's a pricey investment (you know what I mean for you Fitness Reality 810XLT owners) and you can probably spend double the price of this for a dedicated dip/pull up station; however, if you're limited with space, these handle accessories will definitely maximize your space!
customer_reviews.author: Justin E.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Fitness Reality 810XLT Rack
customer_reviews.text: Finally what I was looking for! For all of you asking if this will fit to your rack that is not the Valor Fitness Rack, it is 2x2 beam with 1 inch diameter Hole applicable. Which means it fits my Fitness Reality 810XLT rack that I purchased. My rack has virtually no accessories so finding some that work with it is a challenge. But this did the trick. It is extremely sturdy, great spacing, comfortable grips, and works like a charm. Highly recommend for a Valor Or Fitness Reality 810 Rack
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I didn't think these would hold up well when they first arrived. They seemed a little skinny and the metal didn't appear to be the strongest but I was wrong. I'm 6'2" and 240 pounds and these things hold my big ass no problem. They are extremely durable and for the price you can't beat that. They mount right up to any 2" squat rack and bam you can do dips all day with them. I haven't added extra weight to these so I don't know how well they'd do holding like 300 plus pounds. But if you're that much of a beast you shouldn't be buying cheap stuff on Amazon as is.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide Grip Dips!!!
customer_reviews.text: My issue with this is the distance between the handles. I bought this in conjunction with the Valor Fitness BD-7 and you can see for yourself! Not a typical fit from the standalone dippers in the gym. I'm more used to my arms being slightly off to the side not full on wide angle. For reference I'm 6'2". The metal feels very durable and the handles are a hard type of plastic or rubber, but I use the inside to dip from not the handle, which would be even wider grip.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Dip Handle Add-on!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about these dip handles. They are built solid, and even when supporting my 225 lbs, they don't give a millimeter. They fit perfectly on my New York Barbell TDS Power Rack (H-92560-B) and measure 23 inches handle-to-handle mounted inside, which I find perfect given my wider shoulders. I use them for dips as well as pronated grip and neutral grip pull-ups. Bottom line, if you're looking for dip handles for a 2" square tube power rack, you simply can't beat these. Excellent deal, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dips and other less-obvious functions...
customer_reviews.text: These are great handles and as mentioned, can go inside or outside of the rack. But, something they work great for as pictured here is to create a nice preacher curl addition. With the handles set inward, they hold an ez-curl bar perfectly and allow you to use the BD-7 padded bar as a perfect setup. I love the whole rack, but this was the icing on the cake! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M  McMillin

customer_reviews.title: They fit well on the Atlas Power Rack Squat Deadlift ...
customer_reviews.text: They fit well on the Atlas Power Rack Squat Deadlift Cage, (great rack for the garage, no longer available on Amazon). Note: these handles have a fixed width, which is dependant on your rack. The closest point between them may be too far for some people, but that's not an issue with the handles, it would be an issue with your the rack. I've seen people complain about there being too many Spanish speaking people in Spain, which made them difficult to understand ... I wouldn't be surprised if someone complained about these fixed handles not being adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Jareau

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to remove it needed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect with my Valor fitness rack. Adds to the versatility of the system and is easily removed when not in use. Handles aren't padded, more like hard rubber. But it is sturdy and feels good when doing dips or other exercises. Would recommend for anyone with a Valor fitness rack system.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my IRONMAN H-Class 810XLT Power Cage
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out the best dip bars to order for my IRONMAN H-Class 810XLT Power Cage. After reading the reviews of various products and measuring everything twice, I ordered this product (prime open box), The MB-A fits and works perfect with the Power Cage. My teenage boys like it better than the gym rings that I often use because it allows them to get full range on the dips.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in NY State

customer_reviews.title: I wish they were a bit better built, but they hold up just fine with ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these 3-4 times a week on my Powerline PPR200x power rack and they fit well. I wish they were a bit better built, but they hold up just fine with my 200 lbs + 50 lbs on a dip belt doing 10-15 reps.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: Measure your rack posts before ordering.  If they fit, they look like they will work great
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great shape. Sadly, the thickness of my Weider rack posts was about 3/8" (2-3/8) more than what these can handle (2"). I'm not sending them back. I will have a local weld shop modifiy them to fit my rack. They are powder coated and the handle areas are rubberized. Will be glad when I can use them.
customer_reviews.author: James F Riley Jr

customer_reviews.title: I use mine a lot and they are very sturdy on my power cage (BD-7)
customer_reviews.text: I had get an exchanged set in the mail because the bars sometimes are not even with each other. BUT, Valor fitness will send you out a another pair for exchange no cost. I use mine a lot and they are very sturdy on my power cage (BD-7). You can put them in different positions around the cage as well which makes it nice. I use them high up on my cage when doing dips and I never have any trouble hitting the top. If you position them on the outside front your head will never hit the top no matter what. Great addition to the power cage!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good, but they don't come close enough for my rack.
customer_reviews.text: Like the multipurpose handles, these could flare inwards a tad bit more. I think it might be my rack ( as I watched the demo and the handles seemed to come in closer in that video. These are far better than the dip attachment I have for the bench I got. I might try the dip accessory that goes on the safety bars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y.

customer_reviews.title: Very wide gap
customer_reviews.text: They are built wellish. But the gap is way to far apart to safely do a dip on. So waste of money for me. I am 6 ft 4 and still the gap is a bit wide. A Standard dip station is 20 inches this one is 25... wish i would have read the description before throwing out the shiping box
customer_reviews.author: mattcarr

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for me.
customer_reviews.text: Product is sturdy but unfortunately it appears to be too wide for me. I use this on a Valor BD-7 full rack. The distance between the two handles is about 22.5" . I am 5'8" and just don't feel comfortable doing dips with such a distance.... It put too much stress on the shoulders being pulled apart.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Decent product but grips are very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Good width, plenty sturdy. Grips are hard plastic and super rough on the hands. I weigh 200 lbs and can bang out dips but have to wrap the grips with a towl. Bad grip design. Decent buy to add grips to a rack otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: JeramieOK

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit as good as I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: The insertion points do not fit the greatest upon my squat rack. I was still able to get them to work with a little coaxing. I use them daily even though they are bent in a couple of areas.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hubbs

customer_reviews.title: Two more lifts from one accessory
customer_reviews.text: These handles are a nice addition to the BD-7, and are good for both dips and leg lifts.They're easy to attach and remove quickly as you move through your sets. Was a little concerned about whether these things would be strong enough -- I'm 210 lbs, and the shape of these handles means that there's a whole lot of torque near that first weld. But they've held up very well so far, and show no signs of strain.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I do this sooner?!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my home gym! These bars are sturdy and are perfectly spaced. I have shoulder issues and have had difficulty on other sets of dip bars that were spaced too far apart. The addition of the dip bars is taking my workouts to a new level.
customer_reviews.author: John Colangelo

customer_reviews.title: Fits the fitness reality cage
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to add to the fitness reality cage. They fit and work for this purpose. I’m a heavy set guy 255lbs and these feel like if I were much heavier, they might warp. I don’t think this is necessarily the products fault and it might be all in my head. Overall the best deal I found after research and fit perfectly with the fitness reality cage.
customer_reviews.author: Jaba

customer_reviews.title: Great if your home gym lacks space
customer_reviews.text: I debated going with the free standing dip bars, but I decided on these instead because they fit on my Fitness Reality 810XLT power rack. They feel sturdy. No issues so far. The handles are comfortable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: The dip bars are not welded square. With a ...
customer_reviews.text: The dip bars are not welded square. With a 6ft level measured at the pins when connected to the rack, they are level. When measured at the actual handles there is a 1/4" height difference, which is quite a bit over such a short distance. Had to remove the grip from the high side and pad the low side a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Fits the Fitness Reality 810XLT
customer_reviews.text: They fit my Fitness Reality 810XLT. I'm 230lbs and they seem to be fine. The bars are slightly closer together than the ones on my power tower i had (for pullups,dips, abs), but they are just right as far as i'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: shotgunman006

customer_reviews.title: Good Price. Doubles as curl bar holder.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much weight these can actually handle. They hold me (200lbs) plus a 45lb plate pretty solid. They double as a curl bar holder as well. Great addition to any power rack.
customer_reviews.author: JLar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are some real sturdy dip bars for sure! I weigh 240lbs. I also use them to put my ezbar on when I'm using it!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Trenton Jr

customer_reviews.title: Fits Fitness Reality 810XLT Super Max Power Cage
customer_reviews.text: I am using these with the Fitness Reality 810XLT Super Max Power Cage. They fit perfectly fine, are easy to remove, are a great distance apart for dips, and don't flex at all with my weight on them (195 lbs). I'm sure they will handle more than I will ever throw at them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Williams

customer_reviews.title: Holds heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: I’m 255 lbs and it holds me with no issues. I have them on a fitness reality power rack.
customer_reviews.author: Royce

customer_reviews.title: Just add to cart and buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Have it on my power line power rack. A must have. I’m 5’9” 235lbs and it holds me with no issues. Doesn’t bend or give. Very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Tonyserrano65

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fit on my 810XLT
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’7” 180lbs & this fits perfectly. Very stable on my Fitness Realityl 810XLT. LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my Fitness Reality 810XLT Super Max Power Cage and they fit/work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: je woo sung

customer_reviews.title: For my fitness realty 810XLT
customer_reviews.text: I don't know the exact model of my cage but this works perfectly for dips I purchased the used..
customer_reviews.author: Richard N.

customer_reviews.title: Some good dip bars 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. The handle grips are kind of uncomfortable if you don’t use workout gloves.
customer_reviews.author: C.monts

customer_reviews.title: work as advertised. The handles are made of a ...
customer_reviews.text: work as advertised. The handles are made of a really hard plastic which will hurt your hands. I wrapped mine in tape but now the tape looks nasty and is starting to get sticky. I will try pipe foam next
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: These have been an excellent addition to my power rack. Excellent quality, and they are perfectly level for me. They hold my weight well, 200lbs, and the welds look rock solid. Greta product.
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: Bought these to go with my Titan power rack. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go with my Titan power rack. They fit but the manufacturing tolerances are a little loose. One of the dip handles is really tight on the rack and the other is a bit loose; and one is about an inch lower than the other; and plastic end cap on one is always popping out. But for doing dips they work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up for my cage. This accessory is stable and durable so far. only problem for me personally is that its not comfortable for my hands. But I feel this may be a personal problem since I have thin hands.
customer_reviews.author: marcus goodman

customer_reviews.title: MP-A Dip Handles
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Attached directly to my rack and works great. Couldn't be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wessels

customer_reviews.title: Very nice dip handles
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice piece of equipment . I added foam handles the plastic ones that came with it we're not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: NOT solid steel!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this product but the description is not accurate. The description states that this uses a solid steel rod but that is NOT the case. Its cheap tubing. Im only 170lbs and it feels sturdy enough with my body weight but I dont trust this dip handle for weighted dips. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: david k dunn jr

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are small.
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a very well made product, too bad I could not even try it. It did not fit the tubing on my smith machine due to the dimensions being smaller on the product (2inch) than on my smith machine tubing (2.5-3inch).
customer_reviews.author: Zus

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the power rack!
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine, and are as described. Zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Valor fitness needs way better quality control
customer_reviews.text: Valor fitness needs way better quality control, rough welds, not even, one side does not fit the rack the same as the other.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: ... for my fitness reality 810xlt powerrack and they fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my fitness reality 810xlt powerrack and they fit like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great handles
customer_reviews.text: Fits 810xlt rack very nicely. Grips ensure hands wont slip and the unit feels very strong; I’ve tested 170lbs on each handle and it handled that weight comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Bsingh

customer_reviews.title: They did it good
customer_reviews.text: Fixed width in your power rack. Most people will be fine unless you're abnormally sized. Handles are level, can't complain
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Giving it a 5 for stability and price and quality. The only thing I did was wrap the handles for additional grip.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdier than expected. I've done weighted dips in my cage with these bars and never felt unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Fielder

customer_reviews.title: Great dip bars. Fits tds too.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my short tds rack and they fit. Kinda loose but once you do dips they hold stable.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: One of the dip attachments is very loose and sits about an inch or so below the other. This not only looks terrible, but makes it uneven and borderline unsafe to use. Will update if Valor gets back to me and fixes this issue.
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: great dip attachment!
customer_reviews.text: works great. feels sturdy with all my weight on them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: If you have the Valor rack, you owe it ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have the Valor rack, you owe it to your triceps to get these handles. The welds are clean and strong. They haven't flexed at what would be the rotation point after six months of twice-weekly use. They'll double as an EZ bar rack in your home gym and store cleanly out of the way. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These handles ft my BD-7 perfectly. They are the perfect width apart and handle my weight just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Accessory
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and take off in seconds. Very sturdy. NO wobbling. Good average distance between them. Nothing special about the hand grips, just wide enough to be comfortable. Definitely a worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: UTBadger

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for your cage...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, wish I would’ve bought it sooner. Fits my powerline rack perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SoundSnob

customer_reviews.title: Nice attachment
customer_reviews.text: Great addition for the powerack. Fells secure and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: great addition to power rack
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly on my. Sturdy, hold a 200lb man with no problem, could easily hold a larger man.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works on my Best Fitness Power Rack. Absolutely what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sukusia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, handles well, and great price.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really satisfied with the product and how sturdy and reliable it feels. The handles provide a nice grip as well! Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia C.

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly in my rack and it's nice to add some dips between sets again
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly in my rack and it's nice to add some dips between sets again. These dip handles are awesome and work as intended. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These bars are super sturdy. I have used them with just body ...
customer_reviews.text: These bars are super sturdy. I have used them with just body weight and to do weighted dips and there has been no bending or degrading of any kind. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: cfitz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work great and can rotate out of the way nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: works great the only thing I did not like is the fit . As other reviews have said the machining is a little off. So one of them did not fit as well as the other. Still works really well and worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Rock steady
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my weight rack. I weigh 170 and so far I have dipped with up to 70 lbs of added weight and it is rock steady. Fits the rack just perfect, no slop.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Surfer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my cage
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my cage. My cage isn't a valor fitness but it works just fine. Best value out there and spaced out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect distance for good form.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Poop right in to my no-name rack. Distance is perfect for me. Handles have no knurling, so chalk works for me.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: The handles are slightly further apart than I'd personally like.
customer_reviews.text: The bar dip accessory works very well on my power rack. It should fit any rack that is standard 2". The handles are slightly further apart than I'd personally like.
customer_reviews.author: Enid K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality dip handles!
customer_reviews.text: Nice, very sturdy dip handles that work great with my Valor BD-7 power rack/cage!
customer_reviews.author: Tommio

product_meta.title: Valor Fitness BD-33 Heavy Duty Power Rack/Squat Rack w/Available Power Cage Bundle Options for a Complete Weightlifting Home Gym
feature_bullets: HEAVY DUTY- Constructed of 2” x 2” 12-gauge steel. Rubber base caps encase each foot to add safety, stability, and floor protection.

VERSATILE- Includes a multi-grip pull up station at the top of the rack, allowing for a wide range of exercises and uses. Band/strap peg holes positioned along the top and bottom. Band/strap pegs (MB-L) and spring clips (SC-1) sold separately.
ADJUSTABLE- 27 variable positions for bar support, ranging in height from 15” to 67”. Vibrant numbering system to easily identify variable positions.
STORAGE PEGS- Allows for an organized home gym with 4 plate storage pegs measuring 8” each for ample storage for both Olympic and standard plates.

ADDITIONAL- 500 lb. max load if using the bar catchers outside cage, 650 lb. max load if using bar catchers inside the cage, 750 lb. max load for safety bars. Warranty, 3-year frame and 1-year hardware. Arrives in 2 separate boxes.
